channel.title: üè¢ University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Bridging OOD Detection and Generalization: A Graph-Theoretic View
item.description: A novel graph-theoretic framework bridges OOD detection & generalization, offering theoretical error bounds and competitive empirical performance.

item.title: Most Influential Subset Selection: Challenges, Promises, and Beyond
item.description: Adaptive greedy algorithms significantly improve the accuracy of identifying the most influential subset of training data, overcoming limitations of existing methods that fail to capture complex inter…

item.title: On the Curses of Future and History in Future-dependent Value Functions for Off-policy Evaluation
item.description: This paper tackles the ‘curse of horizon’ in off-policy evaluation for partially observable Markov decision processes (POMDPs) by proposing novel coverage assumptions, enabling polynomial estimation e…

item.title: On the Expressive Power of Tree-Structured Probabilistic Circuits
item.description: Tree-structured probabilistic circuits are surprisingly efficient: this paper proves a quasi-polynomial upper bound on their size, showing they’re almost as expressive as more complex DAG structures.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Gradients as Vitamin for Online Finetuning Decision Transformers
item.description: Boost online finetuning of Decision Transformers by adding TD3 gradients, especially when pretrained with low-reward data.

item.title: Robust Prompt Optimization for Defending Language Models Against Jailbreaking Attacks
item.description: Robust Prompt Optimization (RPO) creates robust LLM defenses against jailbreaking attacks by optimizing a transferable suffix, achieving state-of-the-art robustness.

item.title: SelfCodeAlign: Self-Alignment for Code Generation
item.description: SelfCodeAlign is a novel self-alignment method for code generation LLMs that surpasses existing methods by avoiding reliance on expensive human annotation or proprietary LLMs. The method achieves thi…

item.title: Validating Climate Models with Spherical Convolutional Wasserstein Distance
item.description: Researchers developed Spherical Convolutional Wasserstein Distance (SCWD) to more accurately validate climate models by considering spatial variability and local distributional differences.
